definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: And that's why I send you this loving salutation.
sentences.chinese: 這正是我送你這愛的禮讚的原因。

sentences.english: "How may I sing to you and worship, O, sun?" asked the little flower.
sentences.chinese: “太陽啊，我如何禮讚你呢？”小花怯怯的問。

sentences.english: Praise of White Poplar is a famous essay of Mao Dun .
sentences.chinese: 《白楊禮讚》是茅盾先生的散文名篇。

sentences.english: Chu verses, Han rhymes, all the brilliant poems converged into a chorus of praise for central Anhui;
sentences.chinese: 楚風，漢韻，詩書華章匯成禮讚皖中的大合唱。

sentences.english: The only sound that echoed in its dark dome was that of incantations which I chanted.
sentences.chinese: 在沉黑的仰頂上，獨一的聲音是我禮讚的反響。

sentences.english: The second chapter discusses Shen Congwen emphatically to the healthy human nature praise.
sentences.chinese: 第二章着重探討沈從文對健康人性的禮讚。

definition: paragon of virtue and learning/exemplary character
to pass on the light of Buddha
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
Feast of All Souls (fifteenth day of seventh lunar month) (Buddhism)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
